transcript: Five Below is your one-stop shop for travel size toiletries. Not only do these items fit into even the most compact carry-on, they're all priced low enough to help shoppers save money. These toothbrushes fold up easily to fit in toiletry bags. Hurry though: Just a few colors are still available to shop online. Price: $2 Along with buying a folding toothbrush, it's a good idea to pick up a travel-size Colgate toothpaste. This cheap mini toothpaste is extra handy for carry-on luggage in the event you get food stuck in your teeth during your flight and need to brush before arrival. Price: $2 No matter how long or short your flight is, it's always a good idea to keep a mini deodorant handy to freshen up. Secret deodorant is affordably priced and TSA checkpoint approved at 1.7 ounces. Trending Now: 11 Best New Groceries on Sale at Costco in July Price: $2 For the guys in your traveling party, it never hurts to have Old Spice deodorant handy. At 0.5 ounces, you'll have no trouble slipping one into your carry-on. Price: $2 Heading straight to the hotel after a long day of traveling and don't want to stop at a drugstore to grab toiletries? Each package includes two mini tubs. Price: $5 Snooze away a long flight in a weighted eye mask. Only pink, green and blue styles are available to shop, so snag one while they're still in stock. Price: $4 You might stand outside for a bit to book rideshares once your flight arrives and, for those moments, you'll be glad you packed a travel size sunscreen. The Sun Bum brand is $4 and features SPF 30 to protect skin from harsh UV rays. Price: $3 Freshen up your face before arriving at your destination with Clarisse makeup remover towelettes. Each sleeve is filled with 30 towelettes designed for all skin types. That's Interesting: I'm a Shopping Expert — These 10 Items Are the Best Frugal Buys at Costco Price: $3 Depending where you shop, pill cases and organizers can cost upward of $7. Not at Five Below, where shoppers can pick up a bubble pill case for just $3 apiece. Store all of your prescriptions, vitamins and OTC meds in the pill case's six compartments and save a little extra room in your carry-on that would have otherwise been occupied by bottles and boxes. transcript: Shopping writer Lucy Addicott has chosen her top five electric toothbrush deals for Amazon Prime Day 2025 with one contender saving shoppers more than £300 This article contains affiliate links, we will receive a commission on any sales we generate from it. Learn more Shoppers making the move from manual to electric toothbrushes might want to dive into Amazon Prime Day 2025's oral-care offers as there are some sparkling deals on top brands. The likes of Oral-B and Philips have slashed the prices on some of their gadgets, providing a great opportunity to upgrade a dental routine for less. With discounts of up to £310 off, there are some serious savings to be had and as a shopping writer who has tried and tested over five electric toothbrushes from Oral-B, SURI and more, my hand-picked deals make spotting the best ones a whole lot easier. While a manual brush can do the job, they have nothing on their tech counterparts in terms of ease, functionality and overall results. As the average person spends more than 80 days in their life cleaning their teeth, it's well worth investing in a high quality brush - and these deals mean you don't have to spend a fortune. READ MORE: 'I'm a beauty writer - the new ghd curling wand gave me perfect waves in 15 mins' READ MORE: The best electric toothbrush tested as Oral-B, Philips and Ordo compared To take advantage of the deals customers will need to be a member of Amazon Prime. Those that are not can sign up for a free 30 day trial and enjoy discounts during the duration of Amazon Prime Day. Elsewhere, Oral-B are also running a summer sale, with bundles including free toothbrush heads, toothpaste, mouthwash and more. It is also Boots 'super savings week' and shoppers can find discounts on electricals from brush-baby, Oral-B, Colgate and Philips. Free Amazon Prime membership £8.99 Free Amazon Get Prime here Amazon Prime membership, including exclusive Prime Day discounts and perks on Hello Fresh, music, books and Prime Video. Usually £8.99 a month, you can now get a 30-day free trial to get access to the latest deals. Oral-B iO2 Electric Toothbrush, now £40, was £100 With a 60% off discount, the Oral-B iO2 model is now £39.99 reduced from £100. This beats the price of Boots and the Oral-B website, where it is on sale for £45. It's a top of the range toothbrush as it boasts three brushing modes (daily clean, sensitive and super sensitive), a gum pressure sensor and a 30 second timer letting the user know when to clean a different part of the mouth. It also comes with a travel case, for less than £40 all in. There are various different colours in stock, from black to white, plus spending £3 extra means customers can get a sturdier case with a special design. One shopper was left very impressed with the 'long lasting battery' and another said its 'smooth and quiet clean' has 'exceeded expectations'. Someone else said the 'vibration feels a little rough', but they got used to the sensation 'pretty quickly'. Oral-B iO8 Electric Toothbrush, now £139, was £450 Saving shoppers more than £300, the Oral-B iO8 can be snapped up for £139.99, down from £450. Nearly 70% off, this mega deal has been hailed 'good value for money' as it is a 'five star toothbrush'. Features include six cleaning modes (daily clean, sensitive, whiten, gum care, intense and super sensitive) and sensor alerts. Oral-B's iO8 model takes things up a notch in terms of dentalcare as it boasts AI intelligence, recognising your brushing style and guiding you via an app. The real-time feedback is 'impressive' and 'by far the best' for some, while others found it 'not necessary'. SURI Electric Toothbrush, now £56, was £75 The SURI Sustainable Electric Toothbrush is the device I have been using for the last two years - and it's still serving me well. I find it is reducing my cost of hygienist visits and I've even has friends ask me where I got the toothbrush from when away on trips. On sale at Amazon for £56.25, it is incredibly lightweight, making it perfect for travel, and it comes in four stylish colours. The eco-friendly gadget has been designed to clean teeth with a minimal impact on the environment, using brush heads made from plant-based materials. It is important to note that users will have to stick to the SURI brush heads and you can pick up a pack of three for £14.99. The brand also offers a brush head subscription service. SURI toothbrushes are also 25% off on their website as part of the summer sale. Shoppers can read my full review here. transcript: CBA forward Jack Donohue could be the latest in a line of former Siena ball boys to make their names as Division I basketball players. Donohue worked as a Saints ball boy for four seasons. He began under former coach Mitch Buonaguro and continued for Jimmy Patsos, a friend of Donohue's father, Darren. "It was great," Jack Donohue said. "I loved it. At halftime, you're able to play. When you roll out the balls, you're able to shoot a little bit before you get in trouble. It was fun to be out on the court, like you were a Division I athlete at the age of 10." It's possible Donohue, entering his junior year of high school, could make MVP Arena his home in college. Siena coach Gerry McNamara has offered him a scholarship. But the Saints have growing competition for Donohue, who is 6-foot-7 and 215 pounds. He has been offered by several other schools, including the University at Albany, Bryant and Pennsylvania. Bryant coach Jamion Christian and Penn coach Fran McCaffery are former Siena coaches. "He's a very good shooter," said dad Darren, a Shaker graduate. "He's very tangible, is what all the coaches say. He can rebound, he can run, he's strong and he can really shoot the ball well." Jack Donohue said he's talking to Siena, UAlbany, Penn, Bryant and La Salle about setting up official visits in August and September. He's also speaking with Colgate and Harvard. Assuming he gets to Division I, Donohue will continue a Siena ball boy tradition. McCaffery's sons Connor and Patrick served that role for the Saints before following their father to his next job at Iowa. They played for him with the Hawkeyes. Brothers Kevin and Thomas Huerter were also Siena ball boys. Kevin spent two seasons at Maryland, became a NBA first-round draft pick and now plays for the Chicago Bulls. Thomas played for Siena, his father Tom's alma mater. Siena offered Donohue last month. "To be local and have such a great program, and the history of the program be held on a pedestal, it's great to be having them reach out to me," he said. "The relationship's grown since then. They're always reaching out to me, which is nice." The Donohues credit much of Jack's development to his play with the New Jersey Shoreshots, an AAU program directed by former Rutgers and Robert Morris coach Mike Rice. Donahue played this spring for the 16-and-under team. Quinton Redding, his 16U coach, said he watched Donohue develop from a catch-and-shoot player into someone who has the confidence to put the ball on the floor and become a stronger rebounder. "I feel like he was maybe just trying to fit in, and told him just to be himself," Redding said. "He's here for a reason. Once he heard that advice, he did his thing and took off." Redding said Donohue had his breakout performance at an Under Armour tournament in Hamilton, Ohio in May. He shot better than 40% from 3-point range and rebounded well. "I think he's a mid-major (college prospect) right now and, by the time he gets to his senior year, he has the potential to be a Power Five player," Redding said. Darren, his father, said Stanford and Notre Dame have reached out, but without offers, so far. Jack Donohue gets at least some of his height and talent from his mother, Danielle (Galarneau) Donohue, a 6-foot-1 Troy native. She's in the Marist Hall of Fame after scoring 1,141 points and grabbing 833 rebounds for the Red Foxes. "She played down in the post, so anytime I have any questions about being a post player, or just footwork-wise down low, I always go to her because I know how successful she was on the court," Jack said. He returns next season to a talented CBA team that includes star teammate JJ Osinski, son of former Siena star Corey Osinski. When was a ball boy, Jack Donohue envisioned playing for Siena. He's getting closer to reaching Division I, whether for the Saints or somewhere else. "Just playing at that level alone was a dream of mine," he said. "To now be living it, it's pretty cool." Copyright (C) 2025, Tribune Content Agency, LLC. Portions copyrighted by the respective providers. This story was originally published July 10, 2025 at 3:44 PM.

transcript: Priya Nair's elevation is met with optimism from brokerages, who expect her to steer HUL through competitive pressures and unlock new growth avenues. This is first time a woman will lead the FMCG giant in its 92-year history. Investors and brokerages are cheering India's largest fast moving consumer goods player Hindustan Unilever Ltd's (HUL) latest CEO and MD Priya Nair, who will replace the current chief Rohit Jawa, starting August 1, 2025. HUL announced the appointment of Priya Nair as its new Chief Executive Officer and Managing Director, making her the first woman to lead the FMCG giant in its 92-year history. She is currently President, Beauty & Wellbeing, Unilever. Story continues below In an exchange filing, the FMCG major said that she replaces Rohit Jawa, who will step down as CEO and MD on July 31, 2025 to pursue the next chapter in his personal and professional journey. According to analysts, Priya Nair will provide the FMCG player with the required boost to navigate the rising competitive challenges, while accelerating HUL's digital transformation efforts. Further, with her long-standing experience at HUL, she is well-positioned to help the firm capitalize on the evolving and long-term prospects of the Indian consumption market, stated Japan-based Nomura. The brokerage offered an example from Priya Nair's stint in the Home Care segment from 2014 to 2020. During this time, the segment's EBIT margin soared 570 basis points from 13.1 percent in FY14, to 18.8 percent in FY20. As a result, HUL's overall EBIR margin rose from 15 percent to 22.3 percent over the years. From 2020 to 2022, Priya Nair was instrumental in HUL's premiumization thrust. She drove the shift from from value offerings to the premium segment by driving 26 percent of HUL's portfolio focus towards premium demand spaces compared to 20 percent in 2020. With Nair stepping to the helm, HUL is likely to enter a new phase of growth and innovation, noted Nitin Paranjpe, Chairman, HUL. This will be very closely watched by experts, who have often voiced concerns around the FMCG player's underperformance compared to peers. Thanking Jawa for his contributions, Nitin Paranjpe, Chairman, HUL, said, “On behalf of the Board, I thank Rohit for steering the company through a challenging market and laying the foundations for future success. His strategic clarity and decisive actions further strengthened HUL's leadership.” Story continues below He added, “Priya has had an exemplary career across HUL and Unilever. With her deep knowledge of the Indian consumer and a global perspective, I am confident she will lead HUL into a new phase of growth and innovation.” Over the past five years, shares of HUL have recorded a mere eight percent uptick. However, the change should bring some comfort to the firm's stock price. Citi Research noted that management changes in the Indian consumer space have been a much talked about factor on Street. Further, in recent memory, the markets saw big rallies and eventual business performance improvements at Godrej Consumer and Colgate India, following a change in management. According to Goldman Sachs, HUL's volume growth will gradually improve over FY26. Morgan Stanley and Investec, both, noted that the departure of Rohit Jawa came as a surprise, given his shorter-than-expected stint. The brokerages also pointed to a recent reshuffle in HUL parent Unilever's CEO, with the former CEO stepping down in February. Macquarie, however, allayed concerns, noting that while the sudden departure of Rohit Jawa and the relatively short period of transition remain concerning, the brokerage gains comfort from Priya's long period of experience in India. Further, the change of guard will drive a stronger focus on growth, especially in the Beauty segment. Follow our market blog to catch all the live updates Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

transcript: Background: I got braces at a very young age, I might have been 9 maybe. I believe I had them for 4 - 5 years. (Got them early bc of a surgery I had.) During this time, I neglected my oral hygiene and that led me to develop many cavities. Maybe around 20, I know, a lot. I ended up getting them filled not too long after. I was still left with weak enamel. Fast forward a few years later, I ended up having to get a gum graft. WORST experience ever. It was awful and I don't want to go through it again. I have tried to do everything. I try to floss daily. Brush 1 - 2 times a day. Enamel toothpaste burns so I just don't use it, I just stick to Colgate because it doesn't burn and seems to help a little bit. I do a water + salt rinse. Once a week I do a water + hydrogen peroxide mix. And on top of that I do oil pulling before I brush every night. I'm about to go to the dentist this week but I wanted opinions and suggestions before hand. I have had multiple dentists and they all said many different things. Some say you can reverse recession, others said I can't. Currently 18, and I'm scared that all of these cavities and neglect from when I was younger are going to lead to root canal's, crowns, more gum grafts, or extraction of the tooth in general. Is there any way I can keep my real teeth throughout the majority of my lifetime even with the current damage at a young age.

FLEMING, CEO AND PRESIDENT Gregory J. Fleming is the Chief Executive Officer of Rockefeller Capital Management, a role he has held since the firm, formerly known as Rockefeller & Co., launched in March 2018. He is also a member of the Board of Directors. Prior to leading Rockefeller Capital Management, Greg was the President of Morgan Stanley Wealth Management and Morgan Stanley Investment Management. Before joining Morgan Stanley in 2010, he served as President and Chief Operating Officer of Merrill Lynch, from 2007 to 2009, and previously ran Merrill Lynch's Global Investment Banking business. Greg joined Merrill Lynch as an investment banker in 1992. He had also been a principal at Booz Allen Hamilton. He is a former director of Colgate University, a member of the Board of Advisors for the Yale Law School Center for the Study of Corporate Law; a member of the Council on Foreign Relations, a member of the Economic Club of New York and a trustee at Deerfield Academy. He also serves as a Resource Council member of the Turn 2 Foundation and serves on the Advisory Board of COVR, an innovative financial services startup. Greg is a Phi Beta Kappa, summa cum laude graduate of Colgate University with a bachelor's degree in Economics. He received his J.D. from Yale Law School. transcript: 9/7/25 Homepage carousel summary for Coles Group and Woolworths Supermarkets. Second promo week of the new FY and all seven days of Prime Day are upon us, making the competition for customer dollars even fiercer. Woolworths are running a recruitment drive for their app with a $10 incentive and have over 2000 SKUs on half price, while Coles are running deep discounts on big ticket items in the household, health and beauty space as well as a 40% off dental care hub. Coles 1 - 🎒 Back to school specials. "Shop now" CTA clicks through to Back To School hub page. Sub-categories for breakfast essentials, school lunch & snacking, easy weeknight dinners, stationery & accessories, and recipes. 20% off or more of sandwich fillings (~51 SKUs), 2 for $7 cereal (~20 SKUs), half price essentials (~32 SKUs). Hero image featuring LCM Treatz 5pk, Bonds 1/4 crew sock, Nestle Milo, and Bob Snail fruit roll 60g. "Back to School" also added to the category explorer row of the homepage after Bought Before and Specials. 2 - 🥩 "What's for dinner?" Make dinner delicious. Continues from last week heroing 2 for $15 multibuy on selected meat packs (~23 SKUs this week). "Shop now" and "View recipes" CTAs behave as per last week. 3 - 🚫 Household, health and beauty specials. "Shop specials" CTA is a broken link (8pm 11/7) that looks like it is intended to point to a filtered specials page. Hero image featuring Colgate, Nivea, Swisse, Morning Fresh, and Omo with 40% roundel. 4 - 🪥 Smile brighter for less this week only! "Shop now" CTA clicks through to a hub page with six sub-categories: Power, Whitening, Sensitive, Mouthwash, Flossing, Flavour. Each sub-category has a feature row on the main page, but also clicks through to a feature page for each with a hero brand. Power - Oral-B (Procter & Gamble) Whitening - Colgate Optic White (Colgate-Palmolive) Sensitive - Sensodyne (Haleon) Mouthwash - Listerine (Johnson & Johnson) Flossing - Piksters (Erskine Oral Care / Erskine Dental) Flavour - Hismile Hero image featuring Colgate, Sensodyne, Hismile, Oral-B with 40% roundel. 5 - 🍝 "What's for dinner?" A world of flavor. Continues from last week with "View recipes" CTA. Hero image featuring gnocchi with sausage ragu. 6 - 🕊️ Get 24hr lotion-soft skin with Dove (Unilever). "Shop now" CTA clicks through to brand page with feature row for HP SKUs (~5 SKUs) and additional Dove range ~15 SKUs. Hero image Dove Triple Moisturising 700ml with 1/2 price roundel. 7 - 🍾 Save $30 when you spend $250 on liquor. Save with code offer running till 30/9/25 but limit of 4 redemptions per customer. "Shop now" CTA clicks though to Liquorland range (~2,079 SKUs). Hero image featuring St Hallett, Veuve Clicquot, Chivas Regal, Smirnoff, Jack Daniels, Heineken. Coles Online Only special count ~164 SKUs. #coles #colesonline #fmcg #ecommerce Woolworths continued on following post.

transcript: Amazon India is all set to launch Prime Day 2025, from July 12 to July 14, offering Prime members deals, deep discounts, and entertainment across categories. Additionally, Amazon Pay has rolled out the rewards gold program, where prime members earn 5% cashback and non-prime users get 3% cashback on every eligible transaction after completing 25 Amazon Pay transactions. This offer is only for Prime members, with deals, discounts, and entertainment options. From the latest smartphones and electronics to fashion, beauty, home essentials, and Amazon devices, Prime Day will offer deals across all major categories. Which cards are applicable for deals? Customers can save big with 10% savings on payments using ICICI Bank credit & debit cards, SBI Credit Cards and EMI transactions on ICICI Bank Credit Cards and SBI Credit Cards. *Amazon Pay has introduced rewards gold, a rewards program offering Prime members 5% cashback and non-Prime customers 3% cashback on every eligible transaction. The program is simple to qualify for is to complete any 25 transactions across shopping or payments via Amazon Pay to unlock the rewards. Gold rewards details Any combination of 25 transactions, whether it is UPI payments, sending money, scanning QR codes, making recharges, or shopping - will unlock these premium benefits. The program offers 5% unlimited cashback for Prime members across popular spending categories such as grocery, clothing, travel, entertainment, food delivery, and more. Here are prime deals Smartphones and Accessories Prime Day Premiers will host new launches across top smartphone brands. Customers can get their hands on the latest launches in mobile technology, offering a variety of new features and vibrant colours. The line-up includes Samsung Galaxy M36 5G, OnePlus Nord 5, OnePlus Nord CE5, iQOO Z10 Lite 5G, realme NARZO 80 Lite 5G, HONOR X9c 5G, OPPO Reno14 Series, LAVA Storm Lite 5G and iQOO 13, among others Avail up to 40% off on smartphones and accessories along with exciting offers such as instant bank discounts, up to 24 months of no cost EMI, exchange offers worth up to INR 60,000 and many more. Get exciting deals on Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra 5G, iPhone 15, OnePlus 13s, iQOO NEO 10R and many more flagship smartphones Consumer electronics and personal computing Prime Day features top brands across multiple categories including laptops from HP, Dell, Lenovo, Apple, and Asus; tablets from Apple, Samsung, Lenovo, Xiaomi, and OnePlus; wearables from Samsung, Boat, Noise, Amazfit, and Fireboltt; headphones from Boat, Sony, Boult, JBL, and Bose; speakers from JBL, Boat, Bose, Zebronics, and Sony; and cameras from Sony, GoPro, Insta360, DJI, and Tapo Up to 80% off on electronics, accessories and headphones Up to 50% off on wearables, cameras and accessories along Up to 40% off on laptops and up to 60% off on tablets Up to 60% off on speakers Home entertainment Bring home the cinema experience with big savings on large screen latest televisions. Shop from more than 600 latest TVs along with more than 55 Prime day special launches and avail exciting offers on top TV brands like Sony, Samsung, LG, TCL and Xiaomi: Up to 65% off on televisions with 10% instant bank discount, additional coupons, No Cost EMI options up to 24 months, extended warranty up to 3 years and exchange offers from top brands. Premium television entertainment starting at just ? 99 per day with additional savings up to Rs 20,000 through combined coupon and bank offers, plus upgrade old for new with exchange offers up to Rs 7,000 when trading in your existing television. Shop stress-free from 600+ television options with up to 4 years extended warranty, complimentary shipping and professional installation services included. Home appliances Up to 65% off on home appliances from top brands including LG, Samsung, Haier, Godrej, and Carrier, with customers enjoying exchange discounts up to Rs 17,000 and additional coupon discounts up to Rs 5,000 on the latest energy-efficient refrigerators, washing machines, air conditioners, and other essential home appliances. Up to 60% off on washing machines from LG, Samsung, Bosch, IFB amongst others and air conditioners from Carrier, Daikin, Panasonic, LG and more Up to 55% off on refrigerators from Samsung, Haier, LG, Godrej amongst others and up to 50% off on dishwashers from Bosch, IFB, Faber and more Up to 65% off on chimney from Faber, Elica, Glen, Crompton amongst others and up to 60% off on microwaves from Samsung, LG, Haier and more Fashion and beauty Amazon Fashion and Beauty is turning up the style this Prime Day with massive savings of 50–80% off on over 5 lakh styles across clothing, footwear, beauty, jewellery, watches, and luggage. Prime members can get exclusive early access to platinum new launches from brands like Carat Lane, Titan Raga, Crocs, Puma, Urban Jungle, Lavie Signature, Safari Trackr and Renee Cosmetics. Limited-time express deals: Save up to 70% with 'Get it by Tomorrow' delivery on trending picks 8PM Dossier: Unlock fresh, limited-time offers every night from 8 PM till midnight for extra savings on bestsellers Shop more, save more: Combine deals for up to 20% extra off when you buy multiple styles Extra coupons: Stack up to 10% more off with Amazon Coupons on 50 lakh+ styles op offers: Clothing from GAP, Allen Solly, Libas at 50–80% off, footwear from Puma and Crocs at up to 70% off, beauty and makeup from L'Oréal Paris and Renee at up to 70% off, jewellery from Mia by Tanishq and Carat Lane at 50–80% off, and travel-ready luggage from Samsonite, Mokobara and Urban Jungle at major discounts Up to 60% off on men and women grooming essentials from trusted brands like Philips, AGARO, VEGA and healthcare devices from reliable manufacturers including Agaro, Omron. From Clearance Store steals with min. 60% off, to the Gen Z SERVE storefront, Premium Edit and Monsoon Store, members can upgrade their style, beauty and everyday essentials at prices designed just for Prime Day. transcript: Faire le ménage au RN ? Encore faudrait-il ne pas passer l'aspirateur en mode silencieux, avec le sac percé. Marine Le Pen et Jordan Bardella n'ont pas arrêté de claironner leur volonté de faire “la chasse aux brebis galeuses” au sein du RN. Propre sur lui, sourire Colgate, Bardella se présente en gendre idéal de la Ve République. Et Marine, elle, joue à la candidate républicaine, “dédiabolisée”, presque fréquentable. Mais la réalité ? Elle est beaucoup moins présentable. Et carrément encombrante. 👉 Dernière en date : Caroline Parmentier, très proche de Marine, ex-journaliste au journal ultra-catho Présent, qui qualifiait l'avortement de “génocide moral”, regrettait que le Maréchal Pétain soit “sali” par les historiens, évoquait les “supporters babouins”, le “lobby juif”, et assimilait le préservatif à une “tromperie criminelle”. Et la réaction de Marine ? Une pirouette rhétorique : “C'est une fierté d'avoir arraché certaines personnes à ces pensées-là”. Donc, tout va bien, tant qu'on n'utilise pas trop de majuscules sur Facebook. 🚨 Sauf que ce n'est pas un cas isolé. Une dizaine de députés RN ont récemment tenu des propos racistes ou antisémites. Aucune exclusion. Aucune mise à l'écart. Silence radio. Parce qu'au RN, on ne renie pas ses racines : on les planque sous le tapis du salon. Et pendant ce temps-là, Roger Chudeau, député du Loir-et-Cher, peut attaquer tranquillement les binationaux et Najat Vallaud-Belkacem sans que ça déclenche autre chose qu'un haussement d'épaules. Les “brebis galeuses”, en fait, on les garde… tant qu'elles rapportent des voix. Mais ce n'est pas tout. Parlons un peu des affaires judiciaires : • L'affaire des emplois fictifs au Parlement européen (le RN a été condamné à rembourser plus de 300 000 euros) • Les détournements de fonds publics liés à leurs assistants parlementaires • Les financements obscurs des campagnes (prêts russes, montages bancaires douteux…) • Les procès à répétition pour provocation à la haine raciale, injures publiques ou homophobie • Et plus récemment, les propos d'élus RN qui multiplient les dérapages sans conséquences internes : du racisme soft à la nostalgie pétainiste en passant par le sexisme crasse. 🎭 Le RN “nouveau”, c'est une opération marketing : Bardella fait des selfies à l'Assemblée, serre la main de Sarkozy, et sourit sur CNews comme s'il allait vendre des brosses à dents. Mais grattes un peu sous le vernis, et tu retrouves toujours la même base : une idéologie d'extrême droite, servie par les mêmes réflexes autoritaires, les mêmes ambiguïtés sur les droits humains, et la même indulgence pour les discours nauséabonds. Et à ce rythme-là, ce sont les travailleurs, les retraités, les femmes, les minorités, et tous ceux qui croient à une République sociale, solidaire et laïque qui risquent de payer l'addition. ⸻ 🧨 Conclusion ? Le RN ne chasse pas les brebis galeuses. Il les tond, les maquille, et les met sur les affiches. Et certains continuent de bêler en cadence.
cleaned_transcript: Faire le ménage au RN ? Encore faudrait-il ne pas passer l'aspirateur en mode silencieux, avec le sac percé. Marine Le Pen et Jordan Bardella n'ont pas arrêté de claironner leur volonté de faire “la chasse aux brebis galeuses” au sein du RN. Propre sur lui, sourire Colgate, Bardella se présente en gendre idéal de la Ve République. Et Marine, elle, joue à la candidate républicaine, “dédiabolisée”, presque fréquentable. Mais la réalité ? Elle est beaucoup moins présentable. Et carrément encombrante. Dernière en date : Caroline Parmentier, très proche de Marine, ex-journaliste au journal ultra-catho Présent, qui qualifiait l'avortement de “génocide moral”, regrettait que le Maréchal Pétain soit “sali” par les historiens, évoquait les “supporters babouins”, le “lobby juif”, et assimilait le préservatif à une “tromperie criminelle”. Et la réaction de Marine ? Une pirouette rhétorique : “C'est une fierté d'avoir arraché certaines personnes à ces pensées-là”. Donc, tout va bien, tant qu'on n'utilise pas trop de majuscules sur Facebook. Sauf que ce n'est pas un cas isolé. Une dizaine de députés RN ont récemment tenu des propos racistes ou antisémites. Aucune exclusion. Aucune mise à l'écart. Silence radio. Parce qu'au RN, on ne renie pas ses racines : on les planque sous le tapis du salon. Et pendant ce temps-là, Roger Chudeau, député du Loir-et-Cher, peut attaquer tranquillement les binationaux et Najat Vallaud-Belkacem sans que ça déclenche autre chose qu'un haussement d'épaules. Les “brebis galeuses”, en fait, on les garde… tant qu'elles rapportent des voix. Mais ce n'est pas tout. Le RN “nouveau”, c'est une opération marketing : Bardella fait des selfies à l'Assemblée, serre la main de Sarkozy, et sourit sur CNews comme s'il allait vendre des brosses à dents. Mais grattes un peu sous le vernis, et tu retrouves toujours la même base : une idéologie d'extrême droite, servie par les mêmes réflexes autoritaires, les mêmes ambiguïtés sur les droits humains, et la même indulgence pour les discours nauséabonds. Et à ce rythme-là, ce sont les travailleurs, les retraités, les femmes, les minorités, et tous ceux qui croient à une République sociale, solidaire et laïque qui risquent de payer l'addition. ⸻ Conclusion ? Le RN ne chasse pas les brebis galeuses. Il les tond, les maquille, et les met sur les affiches. Et certains continuent de bêler en cadence.

transcript: Nossa! Olha, a menine boicota produtos americanos! Ui! Que louc4! E o Android ou IOS que tudes usa, é de onde? E o Youtube? Tudes acha que é de onde? Segue a lista, criança birrenta: Tecnologia e Software Windows – sistema operacional da Microsoft, presente em milhões de computadores. Android – embora seja desenvolvido pelo Google, muitas pessoas não sabem que é um produto norte-americano. Google Chrome – navegador mais usado no mundo, criado pela Google. Microsoft Office – pacote de produtividade com Word, Excel, PowerPoint etc. Adobe Photoshop e Acrobat – ferramentas essenciais para design e leitura de PDFs. Apple iOS e macOS – sistemas operacionais dos iPhones e Macs. Zoom – plataforma de videoconferência amplamente usada em empresas e escolas. Dropbox – serviço de armazenamento em nuvem. Instagram, Facebook e WhatsApp – todos pertencem à Meta (EUA). YouTube – plataforma de vídeos do Google. Netflix – serviço de streaming de filmes e séries. Spotify – embora fundado na Suécia, sua operação principal é nos EUA. Amazon – gigante do e-commerce e serviços de nuvem (AWS). TikTok (versão americana) – apesar de ser chinês, a versão usada nos EUA tem adaptações e servidores locais. Marcas de Consumo Nike – roupas e calçados esportivos. Coca-Cola – refrigerante icônico. Pepsi – concorrente direto da Coca-Cola. McDonald's – rede de fast food presente em quase todos os países. Starbucks – cafeteria com presença global. Colgate e Oral-B – produtos de higiene bucal. Johnson & Johnson – produtos de saúde e cuidados pessoais. Entretenimento e Jogos PlayStation (Sony é japonesa, mas muitos jogos populares são dos EUA) – como os da Naughty Dog (The Last of Us). Xbox – console da Microsoft. Steam – plataforma de jogos da Valve. Fortnite – jogo da Epic Games. Call of Duty – franquia da Activision. Educação e Ferramentas Online Coursera e edX – plataformas de cursos online com universidades americanas. Duolingo – app de aprendizado de idiomas. Khan Academy – educação gratuita em diversas áreas. Snacks e Produtos Industrializados Doritos, Ruffles, Cheetos, Lay's – pertencem à PepsiCo, com forte presença nos supermercados brasileiros. Pringles – marca de batata frita em tubo, muito popular e distribuída por empresas americanas como Kellogg's e LTA International Quaker – aveia e cereais matinais da PepsiCo. Heinz – famosa por seus ketchups, mostardas e molhos Kraft – queijos, molhos e produtos processados, parte do grupo Kraft Heinz. Bebidas Coca-Cola – além do refrigerante, também comercializa sucos (Del Valle), chás (Leão) e águas (Crystal). Pepsi – concorrente direta da Coca-Cola, com Gatorade e H2OH! no portfólio. Dr Pepper e 7UP – disponíveis em lojas especializadas e importadoras. Arizona Iced Tea – chá gelado americano, encontrado em empórios e mercados gourmet. Sorvetes e Confeitaria Ben & Jerry's – sorvetes premium da Unilever, com lojas próprias em grandes cidades. Hershey's – chocolates, barras e achocolatados. M&M's, Snickers, Twix – da Mars Inc., amplamente vendidos no Brasil. Reese's – manteiga de amendoim com chocolate, cada vez mais popular. Cereais e Produtos Matinais Kellogg's – Corn Flakes, Sucrilhos, Froot Loops e outros cereais. Post Consumer Brands – como Grape-Nuts e Honey Bunches of Oats, disponíveis em lojas especializadas....

transcript: Tem gente que ainda acredita que combater os EUA é só parar de tomar Coca-Cola, e usar iPhone. O problema não é só ideológico. É falta de percepção, conhecimento — e, sejamos honestos, de inteligência. Quer mesmo boicotar os Estados Unidos? Então esteja pronto para abrir mão de: GPS, Coca-Cola, Fanta, Sprite, Pepsi, Gatorade, Ruffles, Doritos, Cheetos, Lays, Quaker, Heinz, M&M's, Snickers, Twix, Trident, Halls, McDonald's, Burger King, Starbucks, Colgate, Protex, Palmolive, Mr. Músculo, Lysol, Ariel, Downy, Pampers, Gillette, iPhone, iPad, MacBook, iMac, Windows, Microsoft Office, Chrome, Google Search, Google Maps, Waze, Gmail, Google Drive, Android, Instagram, Facebook, WhatsApp, Threads, Messenger, YouTube, Netflix, Disney+, Prime Video, Prime Music, Kindle, Alexa, Fire TV Stick, Xbox, Call of Duty, Candy Crush, Uber, Uber Eats, PayPal, Visa, Mastercard, American Express, Nike, Levi's, GAP, Old Navy, Vans, Converse, Apple Watch, Fitbit, GoPro, JBL, Beats, Dell, HP, Lenovo (divisão EUA), Motorola, Intel, AMD, NVIDIA, Qualcomm, Tesla, Ford, Chevrolet, Jeep, RAM, Chrysler, Dodge, Harley-Davidson, Caterpillar, John Deere, Whirlpool (Brastemp, Consul), GE, 3M, Boeing, Western Digital, Seagate, Kingston, AWS, Azure, IBM, Oracle, Adobe, Autodesk, Paramount, Warner Bros., HBO Max, CNN, ESPN, Marvel, Pixar, Lucasfilm, Marvel Comics... A verdade é que discursos antiglobalização ou antiamericanismo esbarram em um nível de dependência tão profundo que não se resolve com boicote. Se alguém quer de fato reduzir essa influência, o caminho não é ideológico, é técnico e estratégico: passa por décadas de investimento em autonomia tecnológica e produtiva. Mas isso exige algo que poucos políticos, ou nenhum,  no Brasil — e menos ainda seus seguidores — demonstraram até hoje: visão de longo prazo e inteligência real.

transcript: Hi, I'm hoping to get some chances for a few schools Demographics: White, female, upper-middle class, semi-competitive public (Pennsylvania) - Planning on a business/Econ major (if they don't have business) Stats: - 1560 SAT (one sitting, 770 RW 790 math) - 4.0 UW / 4.43 W - 9 APs (HUG 5, Pre-calc 5, both econs 5, Apush 4, Lit, US gov and politics, comparative politics, calc BC) - Senior classes: honors German, AP lit, stage tech, honors meteorology, AP calc BC, honors foreign policy, honors philosophy, AP US gov/politics and AP comparative politics Ecs: - My main EC throughout high school has been my participation in stage tech for sound. I am in charge of writing the cues, running the shows, and just managing that overall -  9/10th grade I helped out with fall and spring play (rehearsal for four weeks, then a week of shows) - 11th grade I helped with three musicals, fall and middle school show reherse at the same time, so I'm very busy for about two months for those. Spring musical which is a really large production at my school (sell over 5000 tickets) - 12th grade I will do the three musicals and also will be a student director for the underclass plays which runs simultaneously with the musicals - While the shows are off I help out with several concerts taking place in the auditorium (probably 1-2 a week during concert season) did about 20 this year - I also have been a "distinguished member" of key club each year (over 200 volunteer hours) - inducted into NHS 11th grade (that's the first year you can do it at my school) - Summer job for three years (small grocery store as a cashier) - Small (like really small) business sellling sports cards - hobbies of genealogy and reading (probably won't include, but might write an essay about it) Essays: - I've been writing the common app, it should be good, not like jaw dropping but not a detractor (I think 💀) 7/10 LOR - English teacher (kinda know her, talked about college and classes) 7.5/10 - Econ teacher (likes me, writes a lot of letters though) 7/10 - Stage tech teacher Schools: I am hoping to major in business or Econ. Please chance me for these schools, let me know if they're reasonable Reaches: UNC (1 parent went there, oos) UVA (1 parent for grad school, idk if it counts) Georgetown Notre Dame IU Kelley Targets/ a few safeties Boston College William & Mary Colgate Penn State Wisconsin Virginia tech Delaware Thanks I really appreciate any feedback or school suggestions

transcript: SPR_COMBO[it]Lamentarsi non basta. Ogni volta che accettiamo passivamente una decisione presa altrove – che sia un dazio, una guerra economica o un'ingiustizia globale – stiamo solo rimandando il momento della nostra dignità. Ma c'è una forma di attivismo che è alla portata di tutti, ogni giorno, in silenzio e con coraggio: scegliere cosa comprare e cosa rifiutare. Dal 1° agosto gli Stati Uniti, per voce di Donald Trump, hanno annunciato nuovi dazi pesanti contro l'Europa e altri paesi. Una mossa unilaterale, punitiva, che rafforza l'idea di un mondo diviso in blocchi dominati da interessi privati. Ma noi, persone normali, abbiamo un potere che sottovalutiamo: il potere del consumo consapevole. Basta con l'America nel carrello Non stiamo parlando di odio, ma di coerenza. Se veniamo attaccati economicamente, se l'Europa è trattata come colonia commerciale, perché dovremmo continuare ad arricchire le multinazionali americane con i nostri acquisti quotidiani? La lista dei marchi americani in Italia è lunga, e li troviamo in ogni supermercato: Coca‑Cola, Kellogg's, Oreo, Pringles Dash, Gillette, Oral‑B, Pampers Colgate, Palmolive, Ajax Swiffer, Mr. Muscle, Glade, Duracell Sono marchi radicati nelle nostre abitudini. Ma non sono insostituibili. E non finisce al supermercato Anche auto, telefoni, lavatrici, computer, TV sono spesso americani: Auto: Ford, Jeep, Tesla Elettrodomestici: Whirlpool, GE, KitchenAid Tecnologie: Apple, Microsoft, HP, Google Smartphone: iPhone, Pixel Servizi digitali: Amazon, Netflix, Meta Ognuno di questi acquisti sostiene un'economia che non ci rispetta. E non ci protegge. Esistono alternative Vuoi una bibita? Scegli un prodotto italiano. Vuoi un'auto? Preferisci europeo, giapponese o coreano. Hai bisogno di tecnologia? Asus, Samsung, Bosch sono opzioni solide e fuori dal circuito USA. Smetti di pensare che non serva a niente. Serve eccome. Se milioni di europei smettono di comprare americano, il messaggio arriva forte. Colpisce dove fa più male: nei profitti. Attivismo è anche questo Non servono bandiere né cortei. Serve coscienza. La prossima volta che prendi in mano una bottiglia, un dentifricio, un detersivo, un telefono, chiediti: sto nutrendo chi mi sta affamando? Boicottare non è odio. È autodifesa. È una forma di solidarietà silenziosa, potente, concreta. Ora tocca a te. Non subire. Reagisci. Comincia dal tuo carrello. Comincia da oggi. ADDENDUM – ELENCO RAGIONATO PER SETTORI DEI PRODOTTI E MARCHI AMERICANI DA BOICOTTARE IN ITALIA Boicottare significa scegliere. Significa usare la propria volontà come leva. Ecco una guida pratica per aiutarti a riconoscere, settore per settore, quali prodotti americani evitare e quali alternative preferire. L'elenco è stato costruito tenendo conto dei marchi con presenza diretta o dominante nel mercato italiano, nella grande distribuzione, nei marketplace e nei servizi digitali. —  ALIMENTARI E BEVANDE Marchi americani da evitare: Coca‑Cola Company → Coca‑Cola, Fanta, Sprite, Powerade, Honest Tea PepsiCo → Pepsi, 7Up, Gatorade, Tropicana, Lay's, Doritos Mondelez International → Oreo, Ritz, Tuc, Philadelphia (nonostante la produzione europea) Kellogg's / Kellanova → Corn Flakes, Rice Krispies, Pringles, Pop-Tarts Hershey's → cioccolato e snack americani Alternative italiane o europee: Bibite: San Benedetto, Lurisia, Galvanina, Spumador Snack: taralli, grissini, biscotti Gentilini, Loacker, Mulino Bianco Colazioni: muesli bio, cereali Alce Nero, Misura, Molino Nicoli —  IGIENE PERSONALE E PULIZIA CASA Marchi americani da evitare: Procter & Gamble → Dash, Ariel, Fairy, Swiffer, Gillette, Oral-B, Head & Shoulders, Pantene, Pampers Colgate-Palmolive → Colgate, Palmolive, Ajax, Sanex SC Johnson → Glade, Duck, Mr. Muscle, Raid, Off Kimberly-Clark → Huggies, Kleenex Alternative: Detergenza: Chanteclair, Winni's, Bio Presto, Nuncas, Verdevero Igiene personale: Spuma di Sciampagna, Neutro Roberts, Antica Erboristeria Cura casa: Emulsio, Felce Azzurra, prodotti Coop e Conad —  CURA DEL BAMBINO Marchi americani: Pampers (P&G), Huggies (Kimberly-Clark), Johnson's Baby (J&J) Alternative: Pannolini: Coop Crescendo, Naturaè, Nappynat (biodegradabili) Cosmesi: Weleda (EU), Fiocchi di Riso (IT) —  TECNOLOGIA, ELETTRONICA, INFORMATICA Marchi americani da evitare: Apple → iPhone, iPad, Mac Microsoft → Windows, Surface, Office, Xbox Google (Alphabet) → Pixel, Chrome, Android, Gmail, Drive, Maps Amazon → Echo, Fire, Kindle, Alexa HP, Dell, Nvidia, Intel → PC, laptop, GPU, CPU Alternative non americane: Smartphone: Fairphone (NL), Samsung (KR), Xiaomi (CN) Laptop: Asus, Acer (Taiwan), Dynabook (ex Toshiba) Cloud: pCloud (CH), Infomaniak (CH), IONOS (DE) —  GRANDI ELETTRODOMESTICI Marchi americani da evitare: Whirlpool → anche Hotpoint, Indesit (sotto controllo USA) GE Appliances (ex General Electric) KitchenAid (parte di Whirlpool) Alternative: Smeg, De'Longhi, Ariston, Candy (IT) Bosch, Siemens (DE) Electrolux, AEG (SE) —  AUTOMOBILI E VEICOLI Marchi americani da evitare: Ford, Tesla, Jeep, Dodge, RAM, Chrysler, Chevrolet Harley-Davidson (moto) Alternative europee e asiatiche: Fiat, Lancia, Peugeot, Opel, Renault, Volkswagen, Toyota, Hyundai —  VIDEOGIOCHI E PIATTAFORME Marchi americani da evitare: Microsoft (Xbox, Game Pass) Sony USA (PlayStation America division) EA Games, Activision Blizzard Alternative: Nintendo (JP), giochi indipendenti europei (GOG.com, CD Projekt Red) —  MARKETPLACE E PIATTAFORME DIGITALI Americani: Amazon, eBay, Meta (Facebook, Instagram), Netflix, YouTube (Google), Apple Store Alternative: e-commerce indipendenti, mercatini locali, social europei emergenti, cinema e piattaforme italiane (RaiPlay, Chili) —  BATTERIE E ACCESSORI Marchi americani: Energizer, Duracell (ex USA, ora Berkshire Hathaway) Alternative: Varta (DE), batterie ricaricabili eco —  RETI E TECNOLOGIE NASCOSTE Presenza americana invisibile ma influente: Cisco (router), AWS Amazon (cloud), Google Analytics Alternative professionali: OVH (FR), Hetzner (DE), Matomo (open source analytics) Certo Mauro, ecco l'aggiornamento dell'addendum con una nuova sezione dedicata ai social —  SOCIAL NETWORK E PIATTAFORME DI COMUNICAZIONE Social americani da boicottare: Meta Platforms (Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp) – il gruppo più pervasivo: controlla conversazioni, relazioni sociali e contenuti X (ex Twitter) – proprietà Elon Musk, orientamento libertario USA, algoritmi opachi TikTok – benché cinese, la versione europea è gestita con standard influenzati dal mercato USA Reddit – forum strutturato in community, molto presente nel dibattito internazionale Snapchat – ancora utilizzato in Italia, soprattutto tra i giovanissimi YouTube (Google) – piattaforma video dominante, con monetizzazione USA-centrica LinkedIn (Microsoft) – principale canale per il networking professionale Alternative etiche, europee o decentralizzate: Mastodon – federato, decentralizzato, senza pubblicità Peertube – alternativa a YouTube, basata su server comunitari Element (Matrix) – messaggistica decentralizzata, cifrata Telegram – anche se russo-emiratino, consente maggiore controllo Signal – alternativa open-source a WhatsApp, senza tracciamento FediLab, Pixelfed – alternative a Instagram all'interno del Fediverso — ❗ PERCHÉ BOICOTTARE I SOCIAL AMERICANI? 1. Gestiscono i tuoi dati come merce: ogni click, messaggio e amicizia viene profilata e venduta a inserzionisti. 2. Sono strumenti di condizionamento politico e culturale, veicolano valori funzionali al potere dominante americano. 3. Oscurano contenuti non allineati, pur mantenendo finta neutralità. 4. Contribuiscono alla dipendenza e alla polarizzazione, secondo modelli studiati da neuroscienziati comportamenta...

transcript: Faire le ménage au RN ? Encore faudrait-il ne pas passer l'aspirateur en mode silencieux, avec le sac percé. Marine Le Pen et Jordan Bardella n'ont pas arrêté de claironner leur volonté de faire “la chasse aux brebis galeuses” au sein du RN. Propre sur lui, sourire Colgate, Bardella se présente en gendre idéal de la Ve République. Et Marine, elle, joue à la candidate républicaine, “dédiabolisée”, presque fréquentable. Mais la réalité ? Elle est beaucoup moins présentable. Et carrément encombrante. 👉 Dernière en date : Caroline Parmentier, très proche de Marine, ex-journaliste au journal ultra-catho Présent, qui qualifiait l'avortement de “génocide moral”, regrettait que le Maréchal Pétain soit “sali” par les historiens, évoquait les “supporters babouins”, le “lobby juif”, et assimilait le préservatif à une “tromperie criminelle”. Et la réaction de Marine ? Une pirouette rhétorique : “C'est une fierté d'avoir arraché certaines personnes à ces pensées-là”. Donc, tout va bien, tant qu'on n'utilise pas trop de majuscules sur Facebook. 🚨 Sauf que ce n'est pas un cas isolé. Une dizaine de députés RN ont récemment tenu des propos racistes ou antisémites. Aucune exclusion. Aucune mise à l'écart. Silence radio. Parce qu'au RN, on ne renie pas ses racines : on les planque sous le tapis du salon. Et pendant ce temps-là, Roger Chudeau, député du Loir-et-Cher, peut attaquer tranquillement les binationaux et Najat Vallaud-Belkacem sans que ça déclenche autre chose qu'un haussement d'épaules. Les “brebis galeuses”, en fait, on les garde… tant qu'elles rapportent des voix. Mais ce n'est pas tout. Parlons un peu des affaires judiciaires : • L'affaire des emplois fictifs au Parlement européen (le RN a été condamné à rembourser plus de 300 000 euros) • Les détournements de fonds publics liés à leurs assistants parlementaires • Les financements obscurs des campagnes (prêts russes, montages bancaires douteux…) • Les procès à répétition pour provocation à la haine raciale, injures publiques ou homophobie • Et plus récemment, les propos d'élus RN qui multiplient les dérapages sans conséquences internes : du racisme soft à la nostalgie pétainiste en passant par le sexisme crasse. 🎭 Le RN “nouveau”, c'est une opération marketing : Bardella fait des selfies à l'Assemblée, serre la main de Sarkozy, et sourit sur CNews comme s'il allait vendre des brosses à dents. Mais grattes un peu sous le vernis, et tu retrouves toujours la même base : une idéologie d'extrême droite, servie par les mêmes réflexes autoritaires, les mêmes ambiguïtés sur les droits humains, et la même indulgence pour les discours nauséabonds. Et à ce rythme-là, ce sont les travailleurs, les retraités, les femmes, les minorités, et tous ceux qui croient à une République sociale, solidaire et laïque qui risquent de payer l'addition. Conclusion ? Le RN ne chasse pas les brebis galeuses. Il les tond, les maquille, et les met sur les affiches. Et certains continuent de bêler en cadence
